headline.main: TEXAS.; Agricultural Capabilities and Prospects of Texas.

docs.lead_paragraph: Few persons unacquainted with the agri cultural resources of this State have the remotest idea of its extent, and no person who has not seen, with his own eyes, the great advantages possessed here over other more populated portions of the Union, will believe how great these advantages are.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; Boys' ACADEMY. FIRE YESTERDAY. MORTALITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Boys' ACADEMY.--The gentlemen engaged in getting up a Boys' Academy in this city have selected a site on the northerly side of Livingston, between Court and Bcerum-streets. The lot is 103 by 100 feet, and cost $16,000. The building, for which plans are already made, will cost about $28,000, making the total cost $17,000. Of this amount, $34,000 have alreary been subscribed for.

headline.main: THE REGISTER'S OFFICE.; Report of the Supervisors' Committee-Communication from the Register.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Supervisors met at the City Hall yesterday afternoon, Recorder TILLOU in the Chair. The troubles in the office of the Register of the County came up for consideration. The following communication from the Register was read: REGISTER'S OFFICE, NEW-YORK, March 17, 1854. To the Honorable the Board of Supervisors of the County of New- York:

docs.lead_paragraph: The dust of yesterday, and the hot weather of the first of the week, for to call it simply warm would be grossly to misrepresent the enterprise of the mercury, which rose to Summer heat, and suggested ice-creams and mosquito-nets to everybody---while it comforted housekeepers who thought of the diminishing coal-heaps in their cellars--prompted sundry scores of those who are in no such habit, to spend a quarter and take a bath.

headline.main: ST. PATRICK'S DAY.; GRAND IRISH FESTIVAL. A QUIET DAY. Five Thousand Persons in Procession. GREAT MILITARY AND CIVIC PARADE. BANQUETS AT THE ASTOR AND APOLLO. Addresses of J. A. McMasters, B. F. Dunning, J. W. Gerard, Moses H. Grinnell and others.

docs.lead_paragraph: St. Patrick's Day, in the morning, was as bright and cheering as the most enthusiastic admirer of that renowned Saint could have desired. For once there was not a cloud in the sky. Nature seemed to be propitious to an occasion so full of pleasant associations to the sons of old Erin.

headline.main: Is Quarantine worth what it Costs?

docs.lead_paragraph: A late number of the Edinburg Review had an article on "Quarantine," written in the Edingburg's best style, and which produced a good deal of sensation at the time. It took the ground that Quarantine Regulations were relies of an illy-informed age --urging that they should be entirely dispensed with, as unnecessary and grievous hindrances to commerce.

headline.main: FROM OREGON.,; Character and Climate of the Country--Political and Commercial Matters--General News.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is not to be denied that, by some means or other, the people of the " States" have obtained and cherished very absurd notions respecting Oregon-its climate, its advancement and present condition. 1 believe that there are few parts of our country concerning which so much has been written, and so little is certainly known.
